newsitem.title: FRANCE: BoF council member calls for focus on employment.
newsitem.headline: BoF council member calls for focus on employment.

text.p: A member of the Bank of France's Monetary Policy Council called on Thursday for the addition of a "sixth criterion" on employment to Maastricht treaty requirements for membership of European monetary union.
Paul Marchelli said that instead of arguing about details or worrying about the next election, politicians in France should attack the problems of the real economy.

"They could show that they are determined to participate without ambiguity in the contruction of Europe. Let them become promoters of a true European social pact. Let them demand the creation of the sixth criterion which was forgotten at Maastricht -- Employment," he wrote, in an article in afternoon daily Le Monde.
